#Text=Dongji Islands
#Text=The Dongji Islands are a chain of islands in the far eastern region of Zhoushan .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The Dongji Islands are a few small islands in the far east of the Zhoushan archipelago .
#Text=The small communities on these islands have recently experienced an upsurge in tourism because a movie called " The Continent " was filmed there .

#Text=Still remote , the islands are far enough out to sea that the silt of the Yangtze River Delta does n't reach the sea around them , giving them nice blue water , a rarity in this region of China .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Take a ferry from Shenjiamen , in Zhoushan .
#Text=Tickets cannot be purchased in advance .

#Text=It 's best to stay overnight near the ferry terminal in Shenjiamen ( if facing the rows of seafood restaurants along the harbor , go left , the ferry terminal is just beyond them , ) and get up early in order to get tickets during any particularly busy season .
#Text=Ferries will take you to Miaozihu ( 庙子湖 ) .
#Text=From there , you can transfer to another boat ( rafted directly to the one you took to Miaozihu ) to Qingbang and Dongfushan Islands .
#Text=Dongfushan is the most scenic .
#Text=When arriving at Miaozihu , going to shore will put you on Miaozihu island , getting on the boat attached to your own boat will take you to Qingbang and Dongfushan .
#Text=The second ferry will cost an additional 40 yuan .
#Text=To leave Dongfushan , ask around as to when tomorrow 's ferry tickets will be on sale .
#Text=They generally go on sale between 6:00 and 8:00PM at the small convenience store at the " lowest " end of town , on the road back to the ferry dock .
#Text=If tickets are unavailable for the ferry from Miaozihu back to Shenjiamen , get in line anyway : The ticket checkers sometimes have a wad of their own tickets which they will sell to you .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Miaozihu has taxis .
#Text=Dongfushan has no automobiles save a few military and construction vehicles .
#Text=There is only one road , and most of the paths along the island are steep and include stone stairs , so you 'll be on foot .
#Text=See
#Text=Dongfushan Island can be hiked in its entirety over about four hours , and allows great views of the surrounding ocean , as well as an abandoned village .
#Text=Eat
#Text=The various guesthouses on Dongfushan Island can prepare food for you , even if you 're not staying there .
#Text=Generally you can walk into the kitchen , select the seafood or vegetables you want them to cook for you , and they 'll give you a price .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=The village on Dongfushan Island has numerous guesthouses which offer reasonable rates ( though they increase on the weekends ) and can also cook food for you for a modest price .
#Text=There is also one hostel with a very relaxed atmosphere .
